alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hardin; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 6:05AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue Today... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa today. This dangerous storm will bring additional light snow across much of the state today with additional accumulations generally an inch or less. Winds will continue to increase, with life threatening blizzard conditions, especially this afternoon to evening across portions of central and northern Iowa. Dangerous temperatures follow this weekend through early next week, with wind chill values down to 45 below zero expected. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero at times. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and northeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact travel throughout the day. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Iowa Department of Transportation reports travel not advised across much of central Iowa this evening, with some roads impassable due to blowing and drifting snow. Towing is not recommended over the much of the area so you may be stranded if an accident occurs.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
